citeinfo.title: Land-Cover Map for the Island of Maui, Hawaii, 2017 (version 1.2, November 2018)

descript.abstract: This dataset describes land cover and vegetation for the island of Maui, Hawaii, 2017, hereinafter the 2017 land-cover map. The 2017 land-cover map is a modified version of the 2010 land-cover map included in the geospatial dataset titled "Mean annual water-budget components for the Island of Maui, Hawaii, for average climate conditions, 1978-2007 rainfall and 2010 land cover (version 2.0)" by Johnson (2017). The 2010 land-cover map was generated by intersecting (merging) multiple spatial datasets that characterize the spatial distribution of rainfall, cloud-water (or fog) interception, irrigation, reference evapotranspiration, direct runoff, soil type, and land cover. Land-cover designations in the 2010 land-cover map were derived mainly from the U.S. Geological Survey LANDFIRE Existing Vegetation Type map (LANDFIRE.HI_110EVT, Refresh 2008) for the island of Maui. The 2017 land-cover map retains the merged structure of the 2010 land-cover map but includes modifications mainly related to agricultural land use since the release of the 2010 land-cover map. Modifications to the 2010 land-cover map included updating the land cover and vegetation designations, and the polygon boundaries in the 2010 land-cover map to reflect (1) the cessation of sugarcane cultivation by Hawaiian Commercial & Sugar Company in December 2016, and (2) the agricultural land-use information described in the Statewide Agricultural Land Use Baseline 2015 map by Melrose and others (2016). These modifications affected about 10 percent of the total area in the 2010 land-cover map. The 2017 land-cover map also distinguishes between (1) forested areas that are within the fog-interception zone, assumed to be at elevations of 2,000 feet and higher on Maui, and (2) forested areas that are below the fog-interception zone. The same distinction was included in the analysis of Johnson and others (2018) and in the spatial structure of the 2010 land-cover map, but was omitted from the land-cover names in the attribute table of the 2010 land-cover map.
descript.purpose: This dataset was developed for use in a water-budget model that estimates groundwater recharge, fog drip, irrigation, evapotranspiration, and runoff.
descript.supplinf:
Version History 1.1 - The process to create version 1.0 of the 2017 land-cover map was modified for version 1.1. In version 1.0, the multi-part to single-part polygon conversion step was applied before the assignment of 2017 land-cover conditions and before the merging of small polygons (less than 0.1 acre in area) with adjacent large polygons. In version 1.1, the multi-part to single-part polygon conversion step was applied after the assignment of 2017 land-cover conditions and after the merging of small polygons with adjacent large polygons. This modification was done to eliminate unintended changes to land-cover conditions assigned to small polygons. In version 1.1, the land-cover conditions in the 2010 land-cover map (Johnson, 2017) were retained for small polygons, except where changes in assigned land-cover conditions were intended.
Version History 1.2 - The process for delineating the fog-interception zone for version 1.1 of the 2017 land-cover map was amended for version 1.2. In version 1.1, areas at elevations of 2,000 feet and greater were assumed to be in the fog-interception zone. Polygons representing areas with an elevation equal to or greater than 2,000 feet, the base of the fog-interception zone, with "Alien forest," "Native forest," and "Tree plantation" land-cover classifications were reassigned as "Alien forest, fog," Native forest, fog," and "Tree plantation, fog," respectively. Polygons representing areas below an elevation of 2,000 feet, with "Alien forest," "Native forest," and "Tree plantation" land-cover classifications were reassigned as "Alien forest, no fog," Native forest, no fog," and "Tree plantation, no fog," respectively. Johnson and others (2018) used the same elevation-based approach to delineate the fog-interception zone but excluded from the fog-interception zone a few small (less than 1 acre), scattered land pinnacles between elevations of 2,000 and 2,100 feet on west Maui. Consequently, in version 1.1 of the 2017 land-cover map, 15 of the roughly 68,000 polygons that were assigned one of the fog and forest land-cover designations were not actually in the fog-interception zone delineated by Johnson and others (2018). In version 1.2 of the 2017 land-cover map, all “fog” and “no fog” designations were assigned to be consistent with the fog-interception zone used by Johnson and others (2018).

theme.themekey: Land Use and Land Cover Map

idinfo.useconst: Users are advised to read the dataset's metadata thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations. The land-cover attributes of this dataset were developed solely for the island of Maui. The dataset is not intended to be used for any purposes other than as input to a water-budget model.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Geological Survey, Pacific Islands Water Science Center

idinfo.native: Environment as of Metadata Creation: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.4.1 (Build 5686) Service Pack N/A (Build N/A)

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: No spatial overlaps were found in the shapefile associated with this metadata file.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata file carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted. The horizontal accuracy of the polygons of this data set is a function of the horizontal accuracies of all other data sets used to create this data set. The horizontal accuracy of each of the other data sets, however, typically was not quantified. Therefore, the horizontal accuracy of this dataset cannot be quantified. See the "Process Steps" section of this metadata file for a list of the other data sets that were used to define the geometry of the polygons in this data set.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set is not applicable.

overview.eaover: The entity and attribute information provided here describes the tabular data associated with the data set. Please review the detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.
overview.eadetcit: The entity and attribute information was generated by the individual and/or agency identified as the originator of the data set. Please review the rest of the metadata file for additional details and information.

distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data for other purposes, nor on all computer systems, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.

stdorder.fees: None. This dataset is provided by USGS as a public service.
